task.name: hifa_fluxcalflag
task.shortdescription: Locate and flag line regions in solar system flux calibrators
task.description:
Search the built-in solar system flux calibrator line catalog for overlaps with the science spectral windows. Generate a list of line overlap regions and flagging commands.
Output
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: vis
param.description: The list of input MeasurementSets. Defaults to the list of MeasurementSets defined in the pipeline context.

param.name: field
param.shortdescription: List of field names or ids
param.description:
The list of field names or field ids for which the models are to be set. Defaults to all fields with intent 'AMPLITUDE'.
example: field='3C279', field='3C279, M82'

param.name: intent
param.description:
A string containing a comma delimited list of intents against which the selected fields are matched. Defaults to all data with amplitude intent.
example: intent='AMPLITUDE'

param.name: spw
param.description:
The list of spectral windows and channels for which bandpasses are computed. Defaults to all science spectral windows.
example: spw='11,13,15,17'

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In interactive mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: threshold
param.shortdescription: Threshold for flagging the entire spw
param.description: If the fraction of an spw occupied by line regions is greater than threshold flag the entire spectral window.

param.name: appendlines
param.shortdescription: Append user defined line regions to the line dictionary
param.description: Append user defined line regions to the line dictionary.

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or display the commands (True)
param.description: Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False).

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Automatically accept results into the context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).

task.example:
1. Locate known lines in any solar system object flux calibrators:
hifa_fluxcalflag()
